text: hello this is chef john from food wishes

about those later
some lemon juice that's half a lemon and
some mint
now mint is my favorite bean herb basil
would work parsley would work but
there's something about mint and bean
salad that's just so wonderful together
so I'm gonna start off with some garlic
I'm going to crush a clove of garlic and
of course all this is the personal taste
but I think garlic also works amazingly
well with a cold bean salad now I'm
lucky enough to have a nice Meyer lemon
tree in my backyard so that half of
lemon gave me quite a bit of juice there
so if you're using crappy supermarket
lemons that don't have a lot of juice
you might need a whole one okay so
anyway that's up to you a few five six
grinds of black pepper and a big pinch
of salt as usual all the amounts will be
on the site all right I'm going to just
whisk that together a little bit now I'm
going to add some olive oil I'm going to
start with a I don't know two or three
tablespoons here and as always we're
going to adjust this stuff later so I'm
going to whip that together now
basically I just made us a Trinette you
know me and my Citroen nuts I love the

oil dressing all right and now we're
going to add our beans to this and start
tossing stuff together so those are

just rinsed them very well I don't want
to eat that sticky gooey gummy bean
stuff that comes in the jar so rinse off
those beans and dry them well there's

sure you check out that demo if you

check out
demo next week and there is my chopped
up mint a couple tablespoons all right
I'm going to toss that together and that
looks like the Italian flag green white
and red actually that does look anything
like a flag but that's a traditional
Italian salad of the color combo those
three but anyway that was by accident I
didn't do that on purpose but mixed that
together now at this point I was
thinking you know what this needs more
olive oil and salt so I could just tell
I didn't even have to taste it it just
seemed a little dry so I put in another
tablespoon olive oil alright and another
couple grinds of black pepper and
another I don't know half a teaspoon of
salt here and what you want to do is let
this sit in the fridge I don't know at
least an hour all right a cell like this
especially with beans that large you're
going to want to let those beans soak up
that nice garlic and mint and lemon
flavor if you work you know starving and
people were pounding their forks and
knives on the table and you had to serve
this they would you know be okay but
you'll be amazed at how much better this
gets if you just let it chill like I say
our minimum a couple hours would be fine
and I just think it's so much better all
right when it comes out of the fridge
make sure you give it a toss and you're
ready to serve now you know I'm not
going to serve this in a stainless steel
bowl I'm going to put it in my designer
beautiful Italian plate or Bowl and put
a little gratuitous sprig of mint on the
edge and you know take a nice picture of
it so there you go
fava bean and butter bean salad go to
